Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: mellseah
Reviews.Content: booked a quad room. i think it was a twin room but they manage to squeeze in extra 2 beds into the room, was really cozy sharing it with my friends! had very little space to walk about but it didnt matter to us. good location. only negative was no complimentary wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Good place and value for undemanding person”
Reviews.Author: rkpoison
Reviews.Content: Good location - one day I took a walk to one direction of Gran Via street and visited all the places of interest of Madrid of this side, and other day I took a walk to the other direction of the Gran Via and visited all the places of interest of Madrid. All these places are reachable by walking. The hotel is not very clean. The room vith a basin is good advantage. The walls between rooms are rather thin, so I had to punch it when a guy behind it started to sing. The orientation of windows is to the Gran Via street, but it just a little disturbed my spleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Shocked”
Reviews.Author: Backpacker911
Reviews.Content: I thought for sure this place would suck, but it was actually quite nice and very safe. Just 4 blocks from the center of Madrid, staff was very friendly and the rooms were very clean. Noise was an issue at times, but not as bad as I thought it would be (tip: bring ear plugs if sensitive to noise). All in all it was pretty cool and I got to meet some other travelers there which is what staying at a hostal is all about right?

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but don't stay if you wanna sleep”
Reviews.Author: Milbybuffalo
Reviews.Content: If you plan to do mostly a lot of partying in Madrid, I recommend staying here. The walls are as thin as paper, so you can hear everything. It's very safe. You drop off your key at the front desk, and must ring the doorbell to re-enter. If you arrive after 11pm, you are given a special card stating that you are staying at the hostal. You must present it to a security guard downstairs, and he will take you all the way up to your hostal, give you your key, and let you in. Mother and father don't speak English, but the son does. Very helpful if you have any questions.

HotelInfo.Name: Hostal Splendid
HotelInfo.Address: Gran Via 15, 50A., 28013 Madrid, Spain
